title: Get started with exsampler
text: exsampler tool assist visual inspection (non)normality. displays 3×3 grids either histograms, QQ plots, detrended QQ plots, PP Plots one randomly assigned plot contains real data eight plots contain data sampled simulated normal distributions (Shapiro–Wilk p’s > 0.05) number observations, mean, standard deviation (optionally, rounding). Plots simulated data help calibrate user’s eyes visually inspecting distribution data. Selecting plot reveals location real data. Users can choose view plots example dataset labeled distributions, use data already loaded global environment.

title: Get started with exsampler
text: First install Rtools CRAN. run following code:

title: Get started with exsampler
text: choose variable generate plots, app displays 3×3 grid panels. One panel contains real data; rest simulated datasets sampled normal distributions number observations, mean, standard deviation. illustrative example using variable “Heavy_Right_Skew” example dataset included exsampler. Histogram – binned frequencies density normal curves using ggplot2.  QQ plot – compares sample quantiles normal reference line using qqplotr.  Detrended QQ plot – compare quantiles’ deviation ’s expected normal distribution using qqplotr.  PP plot – plots proportion observations value proportion predicted normal model using qqplotr.  Click Generate Plots create fresh grid simulations. sidebar lets choose variable, plot type, whether match simulated data granularity (useful integer scales).

title: References
text: following R packages used exsampler package: ggplot2 (Wickham, 2016) glue (Hester & Bryan, 2024) knitr (Xie, 2025) patchwork (Pedersen, 2025) purrr (Wickham & Henry, 2025) qqplotr (Almeida, Loy, & Hofmann, 2018) rmarkdown (Allaire et al., 2024) shiny (Chang et al., 2025) sn (Azzalini, 2023) stats (R Core Team, 2025) testthat (Wickham, 2025)

text: Daniel Wikstrom. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wikstrom D (2025). exsampler: Normal Simulation Guessing Game (Version 0.0.1) [R package]. https://github.com/WikstromD/exsampler.
code: @Manual{,   title = {exsampler: Normal Simulation Guessing Game},   author = {Daniel Wikstrom},   year = {2025},   note = {(version 0.0.1) [R package]},   url = {https://github.com/WikstromD/exsampler}, }

title: Normal Simulation Guessing Game
text: exsampler tool assist visual inspection (non)normality. displays 3×3 grids either histograms, QQ plots, detrended QQ plots, PP Plots one randomly assigned plot contains real data seven plots contain data sampled simulated normal distributions (Shapiro–Wilk p’s > 0.05) number observations, mean, standard deviation (optionally, rounding). Plots simulated data help calibrate user’s eyes visually inspecting distribution data. Selecting plot reveals location real data. Simulated data come random sampling normal distributions; distributions pass widely-used Shapiro-Wilk cutoff p > 0.05, users see guarantee true normal (gaussian) distributions. application intended educational purposes meant formal assessment normality. Read : - Get started - References

title: Creates plots — create_single_plot
text: df data.frame containing sample_data column var variable plot (typically "sample_data") plot_type One "qq_normal", "qq_detrended", "pp_plot", "histogram" bands Optional confidence band types (character vector) xlim Optional numeric length-2 vector x-axis limits ylim Optional numeric length-2 vector y-axis limits

text: n Number samples generate seed Random seed

what: Generates a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
title: Generates a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
text: Simulate 7 additional samples normal distribution mean, standard deviation, (optionally) increment spacing real data, shuffle together “find real data” grid.

title: Generates a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
code: generate_random_data_for_plot_grid(   data,   variable_name,   seed_modifier = 1,   n = 9,   match_increment = TRUE,   p_thresh = 0.05,   max_attempts = 50 )

title: Generates a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
text: data data.frame containing real observations. variable_name Character; name numeric column data simulate . seed_modifier Integer; seed set.seed(), click gives new shuffle. n Integer; total number grids (1 real +7). match_increment Logical; TRUE, rounds simulated values increment real data (via estimate_data_increment). p_thresh Numeric; required Shapiro–Wilk p-value threshold (default 0.01). max_attempts Integer; max resimulation attempts per simulated sample (default 50).

title: Generates a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
text: list elements: shuffled_data_frames: list data.frames, columns sample_data (values) .type ("real" "sim1", "sim2", …), random order. variable_name: always "sample_data" (downstream plotting). real_position: 1-based index shuffled_data_frames real data landed. grid_cols: integer number columns layout (fixed 3).

title: Generates a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
text: Ensures simulated sample passes Shapiro–Wilk normality test p > p_thresh (defaults 0.05), max_attempts retries (default = 50).

text: function launches exsampler interactive Shiny app.

title: Launches exsampler — run_app
